arm_group.description: Patient with fecal incotinence who will be explored using high resoltuion manometry
Healthy volunteers who will be explored using high resoltuion manometry

brief_summary.textblock:
Traditionnal measurment of anorectal function is perfomed with manometric  device using 2 to
      3 pressure sensors. The investigators aim to evaluate the usefulness of high resolution
      manometry to measure anorectal motility

clinical_study.brief_title: Anal Motor Function in Fecal Incontinence

detailed_description.textblock:
Measurment of anorectal function is traditionnaly made using manometric device composed of
      perfused or ballon catheters. This allows the recording of anorectal pressure on 2-3 sites.
      Recently, high resolution manometryu devices using > 36 pressure channels have been
      developped. The investigators therefore aim to evaluate the usefullness of the high
      resolution manometry in patient with fecal incontinence in terms of feasability and
      diagnosis accuracy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patient with fecal incontinence (group "fecal incontinence"

          -  subject without significant medical or surgical hisotry (group healthy controls)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnacy

          -  unable to speack/understand French language

          -  not affilitated to the French healthcare system

          -  history of anorectal disease (for the group of healthy controls) including fecal
             incontinence, or protocologic surgery

          -  constipation

          -  diarrhea

study_pop.textblock: Heathy controls Patient with Fecal Incontience

intervention.description: Anorectal High resoltion manometry using electronic sensors

clinical_study.official_title: Measure of Ano-rectal Motility in Fecal Incontinence

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
